intro: Puya westii, commonly known as the Andean torch, is a striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, spire-like inflorescence that can reach up to 10 meters in height. The plant produces vibrant red and yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. Puya westii is adapted to harsh, cold climates and thrives in well-drained soils. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in the Andean flora.
